attributes.comment:
The new fees proposed by the agency are very reasonable and are not unlike
recent fee increases by other agencies. For instance, the Internal Revenue
Service just increased the fee to adjust a tax issue resulting from no error on the
part of a taxpayer to $3,000 from less than $500. Fees for applying for college
loans are sometimes higher than what is being proposed by the agency and must
be paid by students on an annual basis.

In addition, if the consideration is for the immigrants who are poor, they are
already benefiting from the EITC and child care credits.

The amounts being proposed are not unreasonable considering that living in the
United States and becoming a citizen is invaluable. The fees even after the
increase are a bargain. Also, the department will not be as efficient and as
professional as will be necessary to handle the workload in the future if it is not
modernized.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Edna F. DeGarmo
